business.headline: Volkswagen to trim 35,000 jobs in Germany by 2030Volkswagen is planning to cut 35,000 jobs in Germany by the year 2030. To make the transition easier, Volkswagen is preparing severance packages for affected employees.
Sensex ends 261 points higher; Nifty above 24,600; Eternal gains over 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 261 points to end at 80,998.25, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 77.70 points to close at 24,620.20.

Government seeks lower energy costs for backing green steel incentives: ReportIndia's finance ministry calls for lower energy prices to facilitate incentives for green steel production, amidst concerns over high green hydrogen costs and inflation.
ITR-1, ITR-4 filing begins for AY 2025–26: Are you eligible?The Income Tax Department has enabled online filing of ITR-1 and ITR-4 forms for the assessment year 2025-26.

RBI policy meet begins today: These stocks could rally if rate cut happensThe market is expecting a cut of 25 to 50 basis points (bps), mainly because inflation has been coming down and there are growing worries about slower economic growth.

Why China's rare earth export curbs are shaking global supply chainsChina's recent restrictions on rare earth exports are causing global industry disruptions, prompting urgent diplomatic and economic responses.

GRSE shares jump 10% today: What's fuelling the rally?GRSE shares surged by up to 10% after sealing a partnership with Norway's Kongsberg for India's first Polar Research Vessel, highlighting a pivotal moment in deep-sea research and defence shipbuilding.

Is Rs 1 crore salary still a big deal? Depends on where you live and who you askAn alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad has raised questions about the real value of a 1 crore annual salary in Mumbai. He pointed out that in areas like Borivali or Thane, a Rs 1 crore salary might still make one stand out, but in South Mumbai's boardrooms, where finance and tech executives frequently earn between Rs 1 crore and Rs 5 crore, this income is seen as average.

Trump doubles metal tariffs to 50% but skips UK. What it means for IndiaUS President Donald Trump plans to double tariffs on imported steel and aluminium, affecting global trade dynamics. The UK's exemption contrasts with challenges for India.

Did Coforge shares drop 80% today? Here's all you need to knowInvestors might have initially mistaken this adjustment for a loss. Despite the apparent drop, the stock actually opened higher at Rs 1,720.05 on Wednesday, with a 0.60% increase. It was up 1.4% on the BSE at 12:18 pm.

Are you eligible for PM-Kisan yojana? Check 20th instalment and requirementsThe upcoming 20th instalment is anticipated to be disbursed in the first or second week of June 2025. Under this scheme, farmers can receive the annual financial aid of Rs 6,000, distributed in three equal instalments of Rs 2,000 every four months.

Stop sudden tax demands: Raghuram Rajan on fixing India's business environmentRaghuram Rajan says India must fix its business environment, starting with killing off surprise tax shocks that are scaring investors and strangling the country's shot at global supply chain glory.

Explained: How India can benefit from striking trade deal with USIndia's challenge goes beyond just sealing a US trade deal, it's about finding the right balance between opening up for growth and safeguarding its own industries.

Scoda Tubes lists flat at issue price amid strong IPO subscriptionScoda Tubes saw good interest during its initial public offering (IPO) phase, which ran from May 28 to May 30, 2025. The IPO was oversubscribed by 57.37 times, highlighting strong market demand.

Trump's student visa curbs opportunity for India, says Raghuram RajanRaghuram Rajan has called the US administration's actions "unfortunate," particularly in how they undermine the long-standing academic and economic ties between the US and countries like India.
Sensex opens 144 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; Eternal up over 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 89.35 points to 80,826.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 29.35 points to 24,606 as of 9:32 am.

India rubbed US the wrong way with arms purchase from Russia: Trump officialSpeaking at an event in Washington, US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick said that President Donald Trump deeply admires India and the two countries are going to have a great relationship together.

Nvidia overtakes Microsoft to become world's most valuable companyThis is not the first time Nvidia has reached the top. The company had earlier taken the number one spot on 24 January this year but was later overtaken.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher. Here's whyGift Nifty futures were trading at 24,723, as of 8:06 am, suggesting a higher opening above Nifty's previous close of 24,542.50. The anticipation of a constructive dialogue between the U.S. and China

Stocks to watch on June 4: HDFC Bank, Wipro, Ola Electric, Nestle, Yes BankExplore the latest stock market movements with major stakes sold in Yes Bank, HDFC Bank's IPO plans, and strategic advancements by companies like Wipro and Ola Electric.

Cartier confirms client data stolen in cyberattackCartier confirmed a cyberattack in which client data was stolen, joining a growing list of major brands hit by breaches, including Victoria's Secret, Marks & Spencer, and The North Face.

India needs 8-9% growth to become Viksit Bharat by 2047: Raghuram RajanCan India turn its economic momentum into lasting prosperity? As global risks loom and GDP rankings rise, Raghuram Rajan lays out what it will really take to become a developed nation.

India needs 8-9% growth to become Viksit Bharat by 2047: Raghuram RajanIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV's Consulting Editor Rajdeep Sardesai, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan discussed India's economic outlook in uncertain global times. He emphasised the need for 8-9% growth for India to become a developed nation by 2047.
OECD cuts global growth forecast citing trade war risksThe OECD has reduced its global growth forecast to 2.9% for 2025 and 2026, attributing the slowdown to heightened trade tensions.

Credit score made easy: Check it, fix it, boost itYour credit score is mostly shaped by how timely you are with payments, missing even one EMI or credit card due can bring it down.  A score of 750 or above is considered good by most banks and lending companies.

Sensex closes 636 points lower, Nifty below 24,600; Adani Ports down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 636.24 points to close at 80,737.51, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 174.10 points to end at 24,542.

Smallcap stocks are back in action again. Should you ride the wave?Since the market's low in February 2025, the Nifty50 index has risen by 12%. But the real jump has been in the mid and smallcap space. The midcap index has gone up by 20%, and the smallcap index has climbed 22% during the same period.

Sensex tumbles 700 points: What's behind today's stock market decline?The BSE Sensex was trading 740.82 points lower at 80,632.93 at around 1:13 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 187.65 points to 24,528.95. All the other Nifty sectoral indices also fell as volatility rose during the session.

Own property in India? Why you must fix any paperwork issues nowIn fact, for years, the biggest property scam in India has been when someone who isn't the real owner sells a property. The buyer, after paying a huge amount, later finds out they were cheated, and the actual owner was someone else all along.

ITR filing made easy: Here's a simple step-by-step guide to file income tax returnBefore starting your income tax return, ensure you have key documents in hand. These include Form 16 from your employer, Form 26AS, the Annual Information Statement (AIS) and Tax Information Statement (TIS) from the income tax portal, and your bank statements.

India's GDP growth may decline to 6.2% in FY26, says NomuraThe assessment, published in a research note on Monday, comes amid what the brokerage describes as a growing "divergence" between headline indicators like GST collections and other key economic metrics such as automobile sales and bank credit growth.

Prostarm Info Systems shares make strong D-Street debut; list at 19% premiumProstarm Info Systems share price: The stock listed at Rs 125 on the BSE, which was 19.04% higher than its issue price of Rs 105. On the NSE, the stock opened at Rs 120, marking a 14.28% premium over its issue price.
Ola Electric shares tumble over 6% today. Here's whyBy 10:15 am, the stock was trading at Rs 50.52, down 5.9%, after reports of a large equity transaction rattled investors.

Yes Bank shares fall 8% after 3 sessions of gain. Here's whyYes Bank's shares fell 7.95% to touch a low of Rs 21.43. This was a huge change from the recent trend, as the stock had risen 8.4% in the previous session and was gaining for three days in a row.

Microsoft cuts over 300 jobs in fresh round of layoffs: ReportThe layoffs come just weeks after the company executed its biggest workforce reduction in recent years, signalling a deeper shift across the industry as artificial intelligence takes center stage.

Adani Ports, Adani Enterprises: Why are Adani Group shares in focus today?As of 9:41 am, both Adani Ports and Adani Enterprises were the top losers on the NSE Nifty50, down 1.5% each. Other companies in the Adani portfolio also saw marginal declines in early trade.

NSE shares surge in unlisted market amid IPO buzz. Here's what analysts sayWith over one lakh retail shareholders, a record for any unlisted Indian company, NSE has become a hotspot in the grey market. But analysts tracking the unlisted space suggest the rally may not be over just yet.
Sensex down 150 points, Nifty below 24,700; Adani Ports falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 226.44 points to 81,147.31, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 45.05 points to 24,671.55 as of 9:29 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market open higher to break recent downtrend?As of 8:15 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,845.5, showing a higher start compared to Nifty50's Monday close of 24,716.6.

Prostarm Info Systems IPO listing: Will it make strong market debut? Check GMPThe listing of Prostarm Info Systems comes at a time when recent mainboard IPOs have not performed very well on debut. Bidding was open from May 27 to May 29, 2025, and saw a total subscription of 96.68 times.

entertainment.headline: 'Wicked: For Good' trailer to debut in Arizona theaters on June 4The Wicked: For Good trailer premieres in theaters on June 4, 2025, during a special rerelease of Part 1 at select Arizona Harkins locations. Streaming options are also available.

Raghav Juyal injures leg while shooting for Shah Rukh Khan's King: ReportRaghav Juyal got injured while shooting a tough stunt for Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'King' but continued filming afterward. The movie, releasing in 2026, features a star-studded cast including SRK, Suhana Khan, Deepika Padukone, and more.

Shanaya Kapoor-Vikrant Massey's Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan first look outShanaya Kapoor is set to make her Bollywood debut opposite Vikrant Massey in the romantic drama 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan'. The film's first look has been unveiled and is already generating buzz.

Actor Vishnu Manchu: Hindi films are rooted too, not just South cinemaVishnu Manchu emphasised that Hindi cinema has also produced deeply rooted films. He urged the media to recognise Hindi film successes alongside South Indian cinema's achievements.

Actor Dipika Kakar in ICU after 14-hour cancer surgery, Shoaib shares updateActor Shoaib Ibrahim gave an update about his wife Dipika Kakar's cancer surgery. Kakar underwent a 14-hour-long surgery for her stage two liver cancer.

Jr NTR joins Prashanth Neel's midnight birthday bash, writes touching noteJr NTR shared a special message for director Prashanth Neel on his birthday as fans speculate a behind-the-scenes glimpse from their upcoming film, reportedly titled 'Dragon'.

Pawan Kalyan's Ustaad Bhagat Singh shoot to resume in June, confirms directorPawan Kalyan is set to return to the sets of 'Ustaad Bhagat Singh' as the long-delayed cop drama gears up to resume shoot in June.

Pawan Kalyan's Hari Hara Veera Mallu postponed over VFX, finance issues: ReportAfter several postponements, reports now suggest that Pawan Kalyan's long-delayed period epic 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' may also miss its June 11 release due to complex production issues.
We are our home and light: Hina Khan and Rocky Jaiswal are married. PicsActor Hina Khan got married to her longtime boyfriend, Rocky Jaiswal. Khan shared pictures from the wedding on social media.

Indian rock band Girish and the Chronicles wins hearts on America's Got TalentIndian rock band 'Girish and the Chronicles' wowed the judges on 'America's Got Talent' with a powerful rock version of Adele's 'Set Fire to the Rain'. The performance received a standing ovation and four 'yes' from the judges.

Anushka-Virat receive grand welcome as they arrive in Bengaluru after RCB's IPL winAnushka Sharma and Virat Kohli reached Bengaluru, and fans thronged to their bus to catch a glimpse of the team after RCB won the IPL. The actor shared videos from their visit along with a beautiful note.

Together all the way through: Virat dedicates IPL win to his Bangalore girl AnushkaVirat Kohli shared a loving post for his wife, Anushka Sharma, after the RCB ended its dry spell and lifted its first IPL trophy in 18 years. The cricketer referred to her as his 'Bangalore girl'.

Thug Life banned in Karnataka - what does it mean for film's box officeKamal Haasan and director Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life' is just hours away from its global release on June 5. With the film banned in Karnataka, will it impact the box office?

Exclusive: Rana Daggubati on Rana Naidu 2, and need to turn lens on important thingsActor Rana Daggubati brings the new season of his popular Netflix series 'Rana Naidu'. In an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, the actor, along with Kriti Kharbanda, Abhishek Banerjee and director Karan Anshuman, spoke about the criticism that they received for featuring explicit scenes in the first season of the show, and what has changed this time.
Prakash Jha confirms Raajneeti 2: I am working on it, casting underwayDirector Prakash Jha confirmed that he is currently working on 'Raajneeti 2'. He added that casting is underway.

Metro...In Dino trailer: Anurag Basu film explores love, life, longing in busy cityAnurag Basu returns with 'Metro…In Dino', a film that explores modern love stories set in fast-paced city life. The trailer promises emotional depth, relatable characters, and soulful music by Pritam.

KGF director playfully hits friend in excitement after RCB's IPL win. Watch'KGF' director Prashanth Neel was joyful after Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) lifted the IPL trophy for the first time. He playfully hit his friend in extreme excitement.

Adolescence becomes Netflix's 2nd most-watched English show surpassing Stranger Things 4'Adolescence' has become Netflix's second most-watched English-language series, surpassing 'Stranger Things Season 4' with 141.2 million views in 80 days. Besides, the show 'Wednesday' and non-English hits like 'Squid Game' rank higher in Netflix's all-time viewership.

Actor Nimrit Ahluwalia skipped Diljit Dosanjh's film due to Choti Sarrdaarni shootActor Nimrit Kaur Ahluwalia revealed she missed a film with Diljit Dosanjh due to her 'Choti Sarrdaarni' schedule. She later made her Punjabi debut with 'Shaunki Sardar.'.

general news.headline: Many stampedes...: Siddaramaiah's Kumbh reference after Bengaluru tragedyKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah addressed the media following the deadly stadium stampede in Bengaluru that killed at least 11 and left several injured.

11 dead, 47 injured in stampede outside Bengaluru stadium during RCB eventAt least 11 people died in a stampede during the Karnataka government's felicitation of Royal Challengers Bengaluru for their IPL 2025 win. The crowd surge which led to the stampede occurred outside the Chinnaswamy Stadium.

Why are Europeans sitting on the fence? Indian delegation slams West on terrorAn all-party delegation of Indian MPs, currently on an official tour of Europe, has strongly criticized what they described as global double standards on terrorism. The delegation also highlighted Pakistan's continued support for cross-border terrorism.

Absolutely gutted: Virat Kohli reacts to Bengaluru stampede during RCB eventRCB star Virat Kohli said he was lost for words as he mourned the loss of lives and injuries in a stampede outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru during the team's IPL celebration on Wednesday, June 4.

Hiding behind fake profiles, people threaten to kill judge who denied Sharmishta Panoli bailX accounts with fake, random profile pictures called for 'unknown gunmen' to go after Calcutta High Court's Justice Partha Sarathi Chatterjee.

Putin, Trump discuss India-Pakistan conflict in phone call: KremlinRussian President Putin and US President Trump discussed the India-Pakistan conflict. Trump also shared details about talks on Ukraine, Iran's nuclear program, and global issues, warning Iran about the urgent need to decide on its nuclear future.

Over 20 mild earthquakes shake Karachi in 48 hours, experts warn of bigger quakeKarachi experienced over 20 mild earthquakes in two days, sparking debate amongst experts. While officials urge calm, some geologists warn a major quake could strike soon, adding to public anxiety.

Stampede claimed lives outside Bengaluru stadium, RCB celebrations continued insideThe RCB team was being felicitated inside the Chinnaswamy Stadium after their win over Punjab Kings in the final on Tuesday. But while the celebration went on inside, chaos unfolded outside the venue.
We are our home and light: Hina Khan and Rocky Jaiswal are married. PicsActor Hina Khan got married to her longtime boyfriend, Rocky Jaiswal. Khan shared pictures from the wedding on social media.

Trump proposes $1,000 fast-track fee for US tourist visa interviewsThe Trump administration may introduce a USD 1,000 fast-track fee for non-immigrant visa interviews, but legal experts warn the plan could violate US law and face court challenges.

Putin said Russia will strongly respond to Ukrainian attack on airfields: TrumpUS President Donald Trump said that the conversation with Russian President Vladimir Putin "was a good conversation, but not a conversation that will lead to immediate peace."

Celebration turns into chaos: How Bengaluru stampede unfolded during RCB's IPL bashA stampede outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru left 11 dead and over 40 injured on Wednesday. RCB were rejoicing their IPL success with fans in Bengaluru when the celebration turned into chaos.

Trump policies may drive immigrant wealth creators away from Silicon ValleySergey Brin, Sundar Pichai, Jensen Huang, Elon Musk, Satya Nadella, Dara Khosrowshahi, and Eric Yuan – what do these titans of Silicon Valley have in common?

Indian-origin pharma tycoon arrested in US for healthcare fraudA US-based pharma tycoon, originally from India, has been arrested at Los Angeles International Airport over a $149-million scam, primarily defrauding health insurers. Tonmoy Sharma, who studied medicine in Assam and Delhi, founded the Sovereign Health Group, an addiction treatment provider.

Promptly amended program: RCB reacts to Bengaluru stampede, condoles deathsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru and Karnataka State Cricket Association mourned the death of 11 people in a stampede outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium during the team's IPL victory celebrations on Wednesday, June 4.

Video: Moment stampede broke out during RCB's victory celebrations in BengaluruIndia Today has accessed exclusive video of the moment a stampede broke out outside Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium when a drain slab collapsed, trapping over 50 people during RCB's victory celebrations.

The real Casanova: The spy, alchemist and librarian behind the lover's legendGiacomo Casanova, often remembered as history's greatest lover, led an adventurous life filled with espionage, scientific pursuits, intellectual endeavors, and some truly wild travel stories. He left a legacy far beyond his romantic escapades. On his death anniversary, we delve into his multifaceted life as a spy, alchemist, and intellectual.

Lapses at RCB event, BCCI had no role: Cricket body official on stampedeIndian cricket board secretary Devajit Saikia said the organisers of the IPL victory celebrations in Bengaluru needed better planning. 11 died due to a stampede when thousands gathered to watch the team at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

Indian students are rushing to delete posts for US visa, but that's risky tooAfter the Trump administration's decision to vet social media posts thoroughly for US visas, Indian students are rushing to delete posts and even accounts to fulfil their dream of studying in the US. However, experts suggest this could raise red flags. And it isn't just about posts, even likes and shares could lead to visa denials by the US.

Celebrate Eid, pay Rs 5 lakh PKR as fine: Pakistan to Ahmadiyya MuslimsWith Eid al-Adha approaching, Pakistan's Punjab and Sindh provinces have tightened their stranglehold on the Ahmadiyya Muslim community, imposing a penalty of 5 lakh Pakistani rupees if they take part in the festival or perform qurbani, even in private. This adds to Pakistan's repressive measures over the decades against Ahmadiyya Muslims, who played a key role in the Islamic Republic's formation.

Why we see a red apple red. Is colour in our eyes or in the mind's eye?Colour isn't just a physical property; it's how our brains interpret light reflected from objects. Different creatures perceive colours differently, so colour might be more about perception than reality. Philosophers debate whether colour is real, mental, or a mix of both. Simply put: colour is partly in the world and partly in the mind.

Canada's Strong Border Act will hit Indian asylum-seekersCanada introduced the Strong Borders Act to curb rising asylum claims and strengthen border security against fentanyl trafficking. Last year, over 20,000 asylum claims were filed by international students and Indians were among the cohort with the highest number of such claims.

Man with confirmed train ticket refuses to give up seat for family with RACIn a now-viral post on Reddit, a man travelling via train claimed he was harassed by fellow passengers travelling on RAC. The post has triggered a debate online.

Pak media tycoon thrashes Hindu man, lands in jail after video goes viralA media tycoon in Pakistan was arrested after a video showed him and his armed guards assaulting a Hindu man while his sister pleaded for mercy. The road-rage incident sparked public outrage after the video of the attack went viral.

sports.headline: World No. 361 Lois Bosson lost for words as Paris fairytale continuesLois Boisson, 22, entered the Roland Garros as No. 369 in women's singles tennis. The Frenchwoman has taken out two top-10 players -- Jessica Pegula and Mirra Andreeva -- to script a fairytale run at home.

RCB victory parade stampede: Sachin Tendulkar, Yuvraj condole loss of livesRCB victory parade stampede: India's legendary batter Sachin Tendulkar and World Cup-winning all-rounder Yuvraj Singh expressed their condolences over the "tragic" stampede near Bengaluru's M Chinnaswamy Stadium on Wednesday, which claimed 11 lives.

Celebration turns into chaos: How Bengaluru stampede unfolded during RCB's IPL bashA stampede outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru left 11 dead and over 40 injured on Wednesday. RCB were rejoicing their IPL success with fans in Bengaluru when the celebration turned into chaos.

Jannik Sinner emulates Rafael Nadal, storms into 2nd successive semi-finalWorld No. 1 Jannik Sinner continued his relentless pursuit of a maiden French Open title with a typically efficient 6-1, 7-5, 6-0 win over Kazakh showman Alexander Bublik on Wednesday to reach the semi-finals.

Absolutely gutted: Virat Kohli reacts to Bengaluru stampede during RCB eventRCB star Virat Kohli said he was lost for words as he mourned the loss of lives and injuries in a stampede outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru during the team's IPL celebration on Wednesday, June 4.

BCCI had no knowledge of RCB celebrations: IPL chairman on Bengaluru stampedeIPL Chairman Arun Dhumal called the stampede tragic but clarified that the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) had no knowledge of Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) victory celebration in Bengaluru.

India lose 0-2 to Thailand in football friendly before AFC Asian Cup qualifierIndia lost 0-2 to Thailand in an international football friendly match at Thammasat Stadium, with goals from Ben Davis and Poramet Arjvilai securing a comfortable victory for the under-strength hosts.

PSG describe UCL win emotions with viral Gukesh-Carlsen reaction memeParis Saint-Germain celebrated their maiden Champions League title by drawing a fun parallel with Indian chess World Champion D Gukesh's viral win over Magnus Carlsen, sharing his emotional reaction to reflect their own long-awaited triumph.

Wildcard Lois Boisson stuns Andreeva, joins Coco Gauff in semi-finalWorld No. 361 Loïs Boisson stunned Mirra Andreeva to book her place in the semi-finals, while Coco Gauff huffed and puffed her way into the last four with a hard-fought 6-7(6), 6-4, 6-1 win over fellow American Madison Keys.

Virat Kohli leads RCB's IPL victory celebrations at M Chinnaswamy stadiumRoyal Challengers Bengaluru celebrated their IPL 2025 triumph in front of a massive home crowd at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium, with star Virat Kohli and skipper Rajat Patidar leading the ceremony. Tragically, a stampede led to reported fan fatalities.

Bengaluru IPL celebrations: Virat Kohli, RCB teammates honoured with Mysore PetaVirat Kohli and his RCB teammates were felicitated with traditional Mysore Petas—ceremonial turbans—and garlands of cardamom by Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah.

Virat Kohli thanks RCB fans at Bengaluru bash: No fanbase like this in the worldIPL 2025: Batting star Virat Kohli addressed a huge gathering of fans at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium, calling them the best in the world. RCB celebrated their IPL triumph with fans in Bengaluru on Wednesday, June 04.

IPL victory sends Kohli's social stocks soaring, Iyer shines tooFollowing RCB's win over Punjab Kings, Virat Kohli gained 4.4 lakh new followers on Instagram and over 13,000 on Facebook in just two days. Shreyas Iyer, captain of the runner-up Punjab Kings, saw a surge of over 7 lakh followers in the last three days.

Get addicted to titles, defend IPL crown in 2026: Director Mo Babat to RCBAfter 17 years of heartbreak and near misses, Royal Challengers Bengaluru finally ended their title drought-and their Director of Cricket, Mo Bobat, isn't letting the squad rest on their laurels.

The private event was attended by close family and friends, including Uttar Pradesh teammate Rinku Singh.

IPL champions RCB welcomed by Karnataka Deputy CM on arrival in BengaluruKarnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar warmly welcomed IPL champions RCB in Bengaluru. Star players Virat Kohli and Rajat Patidar received special bouquets, as fans celebrated the team's historic maiden IPL 2025 title victory.

Watch: Groom stops wedding rituals to witness RCB winning IPL trophy after 18 yearsA groom stopped his wedding rituals midway to witness Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) winning their maiden IPL trophy after 18 years. RCB beat Punjab Kings (PBKS) by six runs to win the IPL 2025 final.

Jitesh Sharma emotional as IPL 2025 title dream manifests into realityIPL 2025: Jitesh Sharma was over the moon as his manifestation came true - Royal Challengers Bengaluru lifted their maiden IPL trophy after a six-wicket win over Punjab Kings on Wednesday.

RCB celebrations Highlights: Stampede mars RCB's tribute to fansRCB IPL 2025 victory celebrations Bengaluru Highlights: Royal Challengers Bengaluru stars finished up with the trophy presentation ceremony at the M Chinnaswamy stadium and then went on to their victory lap around the ground. Reports have emerged that atleast 7 people have been feared dead due to a stampede outside the stadium, which was expected to be a fan engagement show.

Rishi Sunak poses with Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma after RCB's IPL triumphFormer UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak was seen celebrating with Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma as Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) beat Punjab Kings (PBKS) by five runs in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025 final).

Day 11 Highlights: Sinner, Boisson, Gauff reach Roland Garros semi-finalFrench Open Day 11 Day 11 Highlights: Jannik Sinner beat Alexander Bublik 6-1, 7-5, 6-0 in straight sets to reach the Roland Garros semifinal. Earlier, Lois Boisson became the first wild card in the Open Era to reach the Women's Singles semi-finals at the French Open. Boisson stunned Mirra Andreeva to join Coco Gauff in the last four of the French Open. Novak Djokovic will be in action on Centre Court on June 5.

No open bus parade for RCB due to traffic congestion fearsIPL 2025: The open bus parade for Royal Challengers Bengaluru after their Indian Premier League win has been called off due to traffic congestion in the city. On Tuesday, RCB won their maiden title after beating Punjab Kings.

RCB to return to Bengaluru for grand victory parade after historic IPL winRoyal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) are heading back to Bengaluru after their historic IPL victory. A grand celebration awaits the team, including a victory parade starting at 3:30 PM from Akku Vidhan Soda and ending at Chinnaswamy Stadium. The team, led by Virat Kohli, won the title after an 18-year wait. Players will visit the assembly and meet the Chief Minister as part of the celebrations.

Ponting not searching for excuses after PBKS' loss, vows to win IPL next yearPunjab Kings (PBKS) head coach Ricky Ponting refrained from giving any excuses following his team's loss in the final of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). RCB beat PBKS by six runs in the final to claim their maiden IPL title.

Meme-material to game-changers: How bowling became RCB's IPL crown jewelOnce ridiculed for their toothless attack, Royal Challengers Bengaluru's bowling unit turned the narrative on its head in IPL 2025. Long seen as meme-material in a batting-heavy franchise, the bowlers rose to the occasion when it mattered most—delivering the knockout punch in the final and sealing RCB's maiden title.

Kohli recalls AB de Villiers' eternal legacy: Still has most POTM awards in IPLRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) batter Virat Kohli recalled AB de Villiers' legacy for the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) as the team ended their 18-year-long ICC trophy drought.

French Open Day 11: Djokovic, Sinner, Gauff eye semis berthFrench Open 2025 Day 11 Order of Play: Novak Djokovic, Jannik Sinner, Coco Gauff, Mirra Andreeva and others will be looking to secure their berths in the semi-finals of the clay-court major.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
